title: Landlord Withholding Deposit
legalText: The landlord shall, within six months after the determination of the tenancy, refund to the tenant the amount of any deposit paid by the tenant in respect of the premises, less any amount applied in accordance with the terms of the tenancy agreement.
plainExplanation: Your landlord must return your deposit within 6 months after you move out. They can only deduct money for legitimate reasons specified in your rental agreement, like unpaid rent or damages beyond normal wear and tear.

title: Police Arrest Without Warrant
legalText: A police officer may without a warrant arrest any person who has committed a felony, whom he suspects upon reasonable grounds of having committed a felony, or against whom a reasonable complaint has been made or credible information has been received or a reasonable suspicion exists of his having been concerned in a felony.
plainExplanation: A police officer can arrest you without a warrant if they have a reasonable suspicion that you have committed a serious crime (a felony). For minor offences, they generally need a warrant from a court.

title: Starting a Business: Sole Proprietorship vs. LLC
legalText: Act 992 provides for the incorporation of companies, the regulation of such companies, and for related matters. A company may be formed as a company limited by shares, a company limited by guarantee, or an unlimited company. A sole proprietorship is not a separate legal entity from its owner.
plainExplanation: The main difference is liability. A Sole Proprietorship is you acting alone; you are personally responsible for all business debts. A Limited Liability Company (LLC) is a separate legal entity; your personal assets are protected from business debts. The rules for forming each are found in the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992).

title: Unfair Dismissal / Termination Without Notice
legalText: An employer may terminate a contract of employment without notice if the worker commits a fundamental breach of the contract. For termination by notice, the length of notice must not be less than one month for a contract of three years or more. An unfair termination may give rise to a claim for compensation.
plainExplanation: Your employer cannot fire you without a valid reason or without following the correct procedure. The Labour Act specifies the required notice periods and valid reasons for termination. If you are fired unfairly or without proper notice, you can seek redress from the National Labour Commission.

title: Noise Pollution from Neighbors
legalText: The Agency may prescribe standards and guidelines relating to the pollution of the environment... including controls of noise and vibration. Additionally, local government by-laws often contain specific provisions regarding noise nuisances, especially during 'quiet hours' (typically from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am).
plainExplanation: Excessive noise, especially at night, is regulated by the EPA Act and, more commonly, by the by-laws of your local Assembly (e.g., your Municipal or District Assembly). You can report persistent noise pollution to your local Assembly office or the EPA.

title: Faulty Goods & Refund Rights
lawName: Sale of Goods Act & Consumer Protection Act
section: Sale of Goods Act S.13; Consumer Protection Act S.6
legalText: The Sale of Goods Act implies a condition that goods sold are of merchantable quality and fit for their purpose. The Consumer Protection Act provides that a consumer has a right to return unsafe or defective goods and choose between a refund, repair, or replacement.
plainExplanation: If an item you buy is faulty or breaks soon after purchase without misuse, you have a right to a remedy. The shop must offer you a refund, repair, or replacement. Your rights are protected under both the older Sale of Goods Act and the newer Consumer Protection Act.

title: Right to Basic Education
legalText: All persons shall have the right to equal educational opportunities and facilities and with a view to achieving the full realization of that right- (a) basic education shall be free, compulsory and available to all;
plainExplanation: The Constitution guarantees every Ghanaian child the right to free and compulsory basic education. This means no child should be denied access to a public basic school due to an inability to pay fees.

title: Right to Vote
legalText: Every citizen of Ghana of eighteen years of age or above and of sound mind has the right to vote and is entitled to be registered as a voter for the purposes of public elections and referenda.
plainExplanation: If you are a Ghanaian citizen, 18 years or older, and of sound mind, you have a constitutional right to register and vote in all public elections. This cannot be taken away from you without due process.

title: Right to Information (RTI)
legalText: The object of this Act is to provide for the implementation of the right to information held by a public institution... to foster a culture of transparency and accountability in public affairs. A person may request for information from a public institution in writing.
plainExplanation: You have a right to request and receive information from any public institution in Ghana. You must make a written request, and the institution is required by law to provide the information within a specified time frame, unless it falls under a specific exemption.

title: Unlawful Demotion at Work
legalText: An employer shall not make a significant change in the status of a worker... without giving the worker prior notice. A significant change includes a change to a lower grade or status. A worker who is subjected to an unfair labour practice may present a complaint to the National Labour Commission.
plainExplanation: Your employer cannot significantly change your job status (like demoting you) without prior notice and a valid reason related to your conduct or capacity. If this happens unfairly, it is considered an unfair labour practice, and you can file a complaint with the National Labour Commission.

title: Eviction Without Notice
legalText: A landlord shall not eject a tenant without a court order unless the tenant has voluntarily vacated the premises.
plainExplanation: Your landlord cannot force you out without proper legal notice and a court order. Even if rent is owed, eviction must follow due process.

title: Freedom of Worship
legalText: All persons shall have the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion, including freedom to practice any religion.
plainExplanation: You have the constitutional right to practice your religion freely, without interference, as long as it does not violate public safety or order.

title: Minimum Wage Enforcement
legalText: The Minister may by legislative instrument prescribe the minimum wage payable to workers.
plainExplanation: Employers must pay at least the national minimum wage. If you're paid less, you can report it to the Labour Department or National Labour Commission.

title: Mobile Money Fraud
legalText: A person who intentionally accesses or uses an electronic payment system to defraud another commits an offence.
plainExplanation: If someone tricks you into sending mobile money under false pretenses, it's a criminal offence. Report it to the police or your service provider immediately.

title: Noise from Religious Gatherings
legalText: The Agency may regulate noise levels from religious and social gatherings to prevent environmental nuisance.
plainExplanation: Churches and mosques must observe noise regulations, especially during quiet hours. You can report excessive noise to the EPA or your local Assembly.

title: Child Maintenance Obligations
legalText: A parent or guardian shall be responsible for the maintenance of a child including education and health needs.
plainExplanation: Both parents are legally required to support their child financially, even if they are separated. You can seek enforcement through the Family Tribunal.

title: Corporal Punishment in Schools
legalText: No person shall subject a child to torture or other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.
plainExplanation: Caning and other harsh punishments in schools are prohibited. Teachers must use non-violent disciplinary methods.

title: Refusal to Issue Tax Identification Number (TIN)
legalText: Every person liable to pay tax shall be issued with a Taxpayer Identification Number.
plainExplanation: You have a right to obtain a TIN for business or personal tax purposes. The Ghana Revenue Authority must issue it upon request.

title: Right to Bail
legalText: A person charged with an offence may be granted bail unless the offence is punishable by death or life imprisonment.
plainExplanation: If you're arrested, you generally have the right to apply for bail unless it's a very serious offence. Bail helps ensure you're not detained unnecessarily.

title: Unlicensed Street Vending
legalText: A District Assembly may regulate street vending and require vendors to obtain permits.
plainExplanation: Selling goods on the street without a permit can lead to fines or confiscation. Always check with your local Assembly for licensing rules.

title: Refusal to Register a Marriage
legalText: A marriage shall be registered with the Registrar of Marriages within the prescribed period.
plainExplanation: You have the right to register your marriage. Refusal by an official without valid reason is unlawful and can be challenged.

title: Refusal to Admit a Child to Public School
legalText: Basic education shall be free, compulsory and available to all.
plainExplanation: No public school can deny admission to a child based on inability to pay fees. Education is a constitutional right.

title: Refusal to Issue NHIS Card
legalText: Every Ghanaian is entitled to register under the National Health Insurance Scheme.
plainExplanation: You have a right to register for NHIS and receive a valid card. If denied without cause, you can appeal to the NHIA.

title: Employer Withholding SSNIT Contributions
legalText: An employer shall remit contributions to SSNIT on behalf of employees within 14 days after the end of each month.
plainExplanation: Your employer must pay your SSNIT contributions on time. Failure to do so is a breach of pension law and can be reported.

title: Refusal to Issue Birth Certificate
lawName: Registration of Births and Deaths Act
legalText: Every birth in Ghana shall be registered within the prescribed period and a certificate issued.
plainExplanation: You have the right to register your child’s birth and receive a certificate. Refusal without valid reason is unlawful and can be challenged.

title: Employer Denying Maternity Leave
legalText: A female employee is entitled to twelve weeks of maternity leave with full pay.
plainExplanation: Pregnant workers are entitled to 12 weeks of paid maternity leave. Employers must not deny this right.

title: Refusal to Provide Medical Records
legalText: A patient has the right to access their medical records upon request.
plainExplanation: You can request your medical records from any hospital or clinic. They must provide them unless legally restricted.

title: Police Demanding Money to Drop Charges
legalText: A public officer who corruptly accepts or solicits any valuable consideration commits an offence.
plainExplanation: It is illegal for police officers to demand money to drop a case. You can report such conduct to the Police Professional Standards Bureau or CHRAJ.

title: Employer Refusing Annual Leave
legalText: A worker is entitled to at least fifteen working days of leave with pay in a calendar year.
plainExplanation: You are entitled to at least 15 paid leave days per year. Employers must not deny this without lawful reason.

title: Refusal to Register a Voter
legalText: Every citizen of Ghana of eighteen years of age or above and of sound mind has the right to vote and is entitled to be registered.
plainExplanation: If you're 18 or older and of sound mind, you must be allowed to register to vote. Denial without cause is unconstitutional.

title: Unlawful Seizure of Property by Police
legalText: A police officer may seize property only under lawful authority and must issue a receipt.
plainExplanation: Police must have legal grounds and issue a receipt when seizing property. Unlawful seizure can be challenged in court.

title: Refusal to Issue Passport
legalText: Every Ghanaian citizen is entitled to apply for and be issued a passport unless disqualified by law.
plainExplanation: You have the right to a Ghanaian passport unless legally barred. Refusal without explanation can be appealed.

title: Employer Denying Sick Leave
legalText: A worker is entitled to sick leave certified by a medical practitioner.
plainExplanation: If you're ill and have a medical certificate, your employer must grant sick leave. Denial is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register a Business Name
legalText: The Registrar shall register a business name unless it is misleading or offensive.
plainExplanation: You can register any lawful business name. Refusal must be based on clear legal grounds.

title: Unlawful Dismissal During Pregnancy
legalText: An employer shall not terminate the employment of a woman during maternity leave or pregnancy unless justified by misconduct.
plainExplanation: You cannot be fired just because you're pregnant. Dismissal must follow due process and be based on valid reasons.

title: Refusal to Issue National ID (Ghana Card)
legalText: Every citizen is entitled to be registered and issued a national identity card.
plainExplanation: You have the right to a Ghana Card. Refusal without legal justification can be challenged.

title: Employer Refusing Payslip
legalText: An employer shall provide a written statement of wages and deductions to the worker.
plainExplanation: You must receive a payslip showing your earnings and deductions. Employers are legally required to provide it.

title: Refusal to Admit NHIS Patient
legalText: A healthcare provider shall not refuse treatment to a person with a valid NHIS card.
plainExplanation: Hospitals must accept NHIS patients. Refusal to treat with a valid card is against the law.

title: Refusal to Issue Driver’s License
legalText: The Authority shall issue a driver’s license to a person who passes the prescribed test.
plainExplanation: If you pass the driving test, DVLA must issue you a license. Refusal without cause is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Enroll Child in Public School
legalText: Every child has the right to education and shall not be denied access to a school.
plainExplanation: Public schools must admit children of school-going age. Refusal without lawful reason violates the child’s right to education.

title: Refusal to Pay SSNIT Contributions
legalText: An employer shall pay social security contributions on behalf of the worker.
plainExplanation: Employers must pay SSNIT for their workers. Failure to do so is illegal and can be reported to SSNIT.

title: Refusal to Issue Land Title Certificate
legalText: A person with valid interest in land is entitled to registration and issuance of a title certificate.
plainExplanation: If you own land legally, you have the right to register it and receive a title certificate. Refusal must be legally justified.

title: Refusal to Release Bail
legalText: A person arrested shall be entitled to bail unless charged with a serious offence punishable by death or life imprisonment.
plainExplanation: You have the right to bail unless charged with a very serious crime. Police must not detain you indefinitely without cause.

title: Refusal to Register NGO
legalText: A person may apply to register a company limited by guarantee for non-profit purposes.
plainExplanation: You can register an NGO as a company limited by guarantee. Refusal must be based on legal grounds, not bias.

title: Refusal to Issue Tax Identification Number (TIN)
legalText: Every person liable to pay tax shall be issued a Tax Identification Number.
plainExplanation: You have the right to a TIN if you're doing business or earning taxable income. Refusal without reason is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Peaceful Protest
legalText: Citizens have the right to assemble peacefully and notify the police in advance.
plainExplanation: You can organize peaceful protests by notifying the police. They cannot ban it without lawful justification.

title: Refusal to Issue Building Permit
legalText: A person shall not commence building without a permit issued by the District Assembly.
plainExplanation: You must apply for a building permit, but the Assembly must process it fairly. Refusal must be based on clear legal reasons.

title: Refusal to Admit Student with Disability
legalText: Educational institutions shall not deny admission to a person by reason of disability.
plainExplanation: Schools must admit students with disabilities. Refusal is discrimination and violates the law.

title: Refusal to Provide Legal Aid
legalText: The Commission shall provide legal aid to persons who cannot afford legal services.
plainExplanation: If you can't afford a lawyer, you can apply for legal aid. Refusal must be based on eligibility, not bias.

title: Refusal to Register SIM Card
legalText: A subscriber shall register a SIM card with valid identification.
plainExplanation: You have the right to register a SIM card with valid ID. Refusal must be based on lawful grounds, not arbitrary denial.

title: Refusal to Register Marriage
legalText: Every marriage celebrated under this Act shall be registered with the Registrar of Marriages.
plainExplanation: If you marry under Ghanaian law, the Registrar must register it. Refusal without legal reason is not allowed.

title: Refusal to Issue Death Certificate
lawName: Registration of Births and Deaths Act
legalText: Every death shall be registered, and a certificate issued to the informant.
plainExplanation: You’re entitled to a death certificate for a deceased relative. Refusal must be legally justified.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Information
legalText: A person has the right to access information held by a public institution unless exempted by law.
plainExplanation: You can request public information from government bodies. They must respond unless the law says otherwise.

title: Refusal to Register Birth of Child Born at Home
lawName: Registration of Births and Deaths Act
legalText: Births occurring outside health facilities shall be registered upon presentation of required documents.
plainExplanation: Even if your child was born at home, you can still register the birth. Authorities must not refuse without cause.

title: Refusal to Allow Disabled Access to Public Building
legalText: Public buildings shall be made accessible to persons with disability.
plainExplanation: Disabled persons must be able to access public buildings. Refusal or lack of access violates the law.

title: Refusal to Issue Business Operating Permit
legalText: District Assemblies shall issue operating permits to businesses that meet lawful requirements.
plainExplanation: If your business meets the legal criteria, the Assembly must issue a permit. Refusal must be explained.

title: Refusal to Admit Pregnant Student
legalText: Every child has the right to education and shall not be denied access due to pregnancy.
plainExplanation: Pregnant students must not be expelled or denied admission. They have a right to continue their education.

title: Refusal to Register a Trade Union
legalText: Workers may form and register trade unions for the promotion of their interests.
plainExplanation: Workers can form unions. Refusal to register one must be based on legal grounds, not intimidation.

title: Refusal to Allow Prisoner Access to Lawyer
legalText: A person charged with a criminal offence shall be permitted to defend himself through legal counsel.
plainExplanation: Prisoners have the right to speak to a lawyer. Denial of access violates constitutional rights.

title: Refusal to Register Cooperative Society
legalText: Any group of persons may apply to register a cooperative society under this Act.
plainExplanation: Groups can register cooperatives. Refusal must be based on legal criteria, not arbitrary decisions.

title: Refusal to Allow Religious Assembly
legalText: All persons shall have the right to freedom of religion and to manifest such religion in worship and practice.
plainExplanation: You can gather for religious worship. Authorities must not block peaceful religious assemblies without lawful reason.

title: Refusal to Register a Political Party
legalText: A political party shall be registered with the Electoral Commission upon meeting the requirements.
plainExplanation: Any group meeting the legal criteria can register a political party. Refusal must be based on law, not bias.

title: Refusal to Issue Environmental Permit
legalText: No person shall commence a project without an environmental permit issued by the EPA.
plainExplanation: You must apply for an EPA permit before starting certain projects. Refusal must be based on environmental law.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Court Proceedings
legalText: Except in special cases, court proceedings shall be held in public.
plainExplanation: You can attend most court hearings. Refusal must be based on specific legal exceptions.

title: Refusal to Register a Patent
legalText: An invention shall be patentable if it is new, involves an inventive step, and is industrially applicable.
plainExplanation: You can register a patent for a new invention. Refusal must be based on clear legal criteria.

title: Refusal to Register Trademark
legalText: A person may apply to register a trademark that is distinctive and not misleading.
plainExplanation: You can register a unique brand name or logo. Refusal must be based on legal reasons like similarity or deception.

title: Refusal to Issue Voter ID Card
legalText: Every citizen of Ghana of eighteen years or above and of sound mind has the right to vote.
plainExplanation: If you're eligible, you must be issued a voter ID. Refusal without lawful reason violates your constitutional rights.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Toilet
legalText: Public sanitation facilities shall be accessible to all persons without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use public toilets. Refusal based on status, disability, or appearance is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register Vehicle
legalText: Every motor vehicle shall be registered with the licensing authority upon meeting legal requirements.
plainExplanation: If your vehicle meets the legal criteria, DVLA must register it. Refusal must be based on clear violations.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Polling Station
legalText: A registered voter shall be allowed to vote at the polling station where they are registered.
plainExplanation: If you're registered, you must be allowed to vote at your polling station. Refusal is a breach of electoral law.

title: Refusal to Provide Water in Public School
legalText: Institutions shall provide safe drinking water and sanitation facilities.
plainExplanation: Public schools must provide clean water. Refusal or neglect violates health and education standards.

title: Refusal to Allow Market Stall Renewal
legalText: District Assemblies shall regulate and renew market stall permits fairly.
plainExplanation: If you’ve followed the rules, your market stall permit should be renewed. Refusal must be legally justified.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Library
legalText: All persons shall have the right to equal educational opportunities and facilities.
plainExplanation: Public libraries must be open to all. Refusal based on appearance, age, or background is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Street Hawking Without Just Cause
legalText: Assemblies may regulate street trading but must not discriminate or act arbitrarily.
plainExplanation: Street hawkers must be treated fairly. Refusal to issue or renew permits must follow due process.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Transport
legalText: Public transport shall be made accessible to persons with disability.
plainExplanation: Disabled persons must not be denied access to public transport. Refusal violates inclusion laws.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Park
legalText: Public spaces shall be managed for the benefit of all residents.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use public parks. Refusal based on appearance, age, or background is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Hospital
legalText: No person shall be denied emergency medical care at a public health facility.
plainExplanation: Public hospitals must treat you in emergencies. Refusal violates your right to health and safety.

title: Refusal to Register a Will
legalText: A will may be deposited at the court for safekeeping and registration.
plainExplanation: You can register your will with the court. Refusal must be based on legal flaws, not personal bias.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Fire Service
legalText: The Fire Service shall respond to emergencies and protect life and property.
plainExplanation: You can call the Fire Service in emergencies. Refusal to respond violates public safety obligations.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Birth Records
lawName: Registration of Births and Deaths Act
legalText: A person may apply to inspect or obtain a copy of a registered birth record.
plainExplanation: You can request your birth record. Refusal must be based on legal restrictions, not delay or neglect.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Cemetery
legalText: Assemblies shall manage public cemeteries for lawful burial and visitation.
plainExplanation: You have the right to bury loved ones or visit graves in public cemeteries. Refusal must follow lawful procedures.

title: Refusal to Register a Church
legalText: A religious body may register as a company limited by guarantee.
plainExplanation: Churches can register legally. Refusal must be based on valid legal grounds, not discrimination.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Toilet for Women
legalText: Sanitation facilities shall be provided without discrimination based on gender.
plainExplanation: Women must have equal access to public toilets. Refusal is a violation of health and gender rights.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public School for Orphans
legalText: Every child has the right to education regardless of parental status.
plainExplanation: Orphans must be admitted to public schools. Refusal based on family status is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Water Point
legalText: Safe drinking water shall be made available to all persons without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to access public water sources. Refusal violates health and sanitation laws.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Shelter
legalText: Assemblies shall provide emergency shelter and support to vulnerable persons.
plainExplanation: You can seek shelter in emergencies. Refusal must be based on lawful criteria, not discrimination.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Employment Center
legalText: Employment centers shall be open to all job seekers without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You can visit public job centers. Refusal based on appearance or background is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Legal Aid Office
legalText: Legal aid shall be provided to persons who qualify under the law.
plainExplanation: You can seek help from legal aid offices. Refusal must be based on eligibility, not bias or delay.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Market
legalText: Markets shall be managed fairly and access granted to lawful traders.
plainExplanation: You can trade in public markets if you meet the rules. Refusal must be legally justified.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Transport Terminal
legalText: Transport terminals shall be open to the public and managed without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use public transport terminals. Refusal based on status or appearance is unlawful.

title: Unlawful Demolition of a House
legalText: No person shall demolish or interfere with another’s property without a court order or lawful authority.
plainExplanation: Your house cannot be demolished without a court order or legal notice. If it happens without due process, it's unlawful and can be challenged.

title: Lawful Demolition After Notice
legalText: Assemblies may demolish unauthorized structures after issuing proper notice and following legal procedures.
plainExplanation: If your building lacks permits or violates planning laws, it may be demolished—but only after proper notice and legal steps.

title: Refusal to Compensate After Lawful Demolition
legalText: Where land is compulsorily acquired, the owner shall be compensated fairly and promptly.
plainExplanation: If your house is lawfully demolished for public use, you’re entitled to compensation. Refusal to pay is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Land Commission Records
legalText: A person may inspect land records upon request unless restricted by law.
plainExplanation: You can request land ownership records. Refusal must be based on legal restrictions, not delay or bias.

title: Refusal to Issue Building Completion Certificate
legalText: Assemblies shall issue completion certificates upon inspection and compliance with building regulations.
plainExplanation: If your building meets all legal standards, you must be issued a completion certificate. Refusal must be explained.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Electricity Connection
legalText: Licensed providers shall supply electricity to lawful premises upon application.
plainExplanation: If your house is legally built, ECG must connect electricity. Refusal must be based on lawful reasons.

title: Refusal to Connect Water Supply
legalText: Water supply shall be provided to lawful premises upon request and payment of fees.
plainExplanation: You can apply for water connection to your home. Refusal must be based on legal or technical grounds.

title: Refusal to Issue Property Tax Bill
legalText: Assemblies shall assess and issue property tax bills to owners of immovable property.
plainExplanation: You must receive a property tax bill if you own land or buildings. Refusal or delay violates local governance rules.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Land Valuation Records
legalText: A person may request valuation records for land or property held by the state.
plainExplanation: You can inspect land valuation records. Refusal must be based on legal restrictions, not secrecy.

title: Refusal to Recognize Customary Land Ownership
legalText: Customary land ownership shall be recognized and registered under the law.
plainExplanation: If you own land through customary inheritance, it must be recognized. Refusal to register it violates your rights.

title: Refusal to Acknowledge Lease Agreement
legalText: A lease agreement duly executed shall be recognized and enforced under the law.
plainExplanation: If you have a signed lease, it must be respected. Refusal to acknowledge it is unlawful unless proven invalid.

title: Refusal to Transfer Land Title After Sale
legalText: A purchaser of land shall be entitled to registration of title upon completion of sale.
plainExplanation: If you’ve bought land legally, the seller must help transfer the title. Refusal violates your ownership rights.

title: Refusal to Recognize Customary Boundary Markers
legalText: Customary boundaries shall be respected and may be surveyed for formal registration.
plainExplanation: Traditional land boundaries must be respected. Refusal to recognize them can lead to legal disputes.

title: Refusal to Issue Site Plan
legalText: A licensed surveyor shall prepare a site plan upon request and payment of fees.
plainExplanation: You can request a site plan for your land. Refusal by a surveyor or authority must be legally justified.

title: Refusal to Register Land Inheritance
legalText: A person who inherits land shall be entitled to register their interest under the law.
plainExplanation: If you inherit land, you can register it. Refusal must be based on legal disputes, not delay or bias.

title: Refusal to Recognize Tenant’s Rights After 6 Months
legalText: A tenant who occupies premises for six months or more shall be protected under the Rent Act.
plainExplanation: If you’ve lived in a place for over 6 months, you gain legal protections. Landlords must follow due process to evict.

title: Refusal to Refund Rent Advance After Eviction
legalText: Where a tenancy is terminated prematurely, the landlord shall refund unused rent advance.
plainExplanation: If you're evicted before your rent period ends, the landlord must refund the balance. Refusal is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Tenant to Repair Leaking Roof
legalText: Tenants may carry out urgent repairs and recover costs if the landlord fails to act.
plainExplanation: If your landlord ignores urgent repairs, you can fix them and claim the cost. Refusal to allow this violates tenant rights.

title: Refusal to Recognize Joint Ownership of Land
legalText: Land may be jointly owned and registered in the names of two or more persons.
plainExplanation: If you co-own land, your name must be on the title. Refusal to register joint ownership is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Recognize Land Owned by Woman
legalText: All persons, regardless of gender, shall have equal rights to own and register land.
plainExplanation: Women have equal rights to own land. Refusal to recognize or register it is discrimination and violates the law.

title: Refusal to Issue Food Vendor Permit
legalText: A person shall not sell food for public consumption without a permit from the appropriate authority.
plainExplanation: You can get a permit to sell food if you meet health standards. Refusal must be based on legitimate health or safety concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Beach
legalText: All public lands, waters, and resources shall be held in trust for the people of Ghana.
plainExplanation: Public beaches belong to all Ghanaians. You cannot be denied access without lawful justification.

title: Refusal to Register Child's Name After Divorce
legalText: Both parents retain parental rights and responsibilities after divorce unless otherwise ordered by court.
plainExplanation: Both parents have equal rights to register a child's name. Refusal based on marital status is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Breastfeeding at Work
legalText: A nursing mother shall be allowed breaks during working hours for breastfeeding.
plainExplanation: Employers must provide time and space for breastfeeding. Refusal violates your rights as a working mother.

title: Refusal to Issue Fire Safety Certificate
legalText: Public buildings shall obtain fire safety certificates upon meeting prescribed standards.
plainExplanation: If your building meets fire safety standards, you must be issued a certificate. Refusal must be based on legitimate safety concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Write Exams Due to Fees
legalText: Basic education shall be free, compulsory and available to all.
plainExplanation: Public schools cannot prevent students from writing exams due to unpaid fees. Education is a constitutional right.

title: Refusal to Provide Reasonable Accommodation for Disability
legalText: Employers and educational institutions shall provide reasonable accommodation for persons with disability.
plainExplanation: Workplaces and schools must make necessary adjustments for disabled persons. Refusal is discrimination.

title: Refusal to Allow Union Activities at Workplace
legalText: Workers shall have the right to form and join trade unions and to participate in union activities.
plainExplanation: Employers cannot prevent lawful union activities. Refusal violates workers' rights to organize.

title: Refusal to Issue Export License
legalText: The Commissioner may issue export licenses for goods that meet legal requirements.
plainExplanation: If your export goods meet legal standards, you must be issued a license. Refusal must be based on lawful grounds.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Archives
lawName: Public Records and Archives Administration Act
legalText: Public archives shall be accessible to citizens for research and information purposes.
plainExplanation: You have the right to access public archives. Refusal must be based on specific legal restrictions.

title: Refusal to Register Traditional Medicine Practice
legalText: A person may apply to register as a practitioner of traditional medicine upon meeting requirements.
plainExplanation: Traditional healers can register their practice. Refusal must be based on failure to meet standards, not bias.

title: Refusal to Allow Student Transfer Between Public Schools
legalText: No child shall be denied transfer between public schools without lawful justification.
plainExplanation: Students can transfer between public schools. Refusal must be based on legitimate educational reasons.

title: Refusal to Issue Liquor License
legalText: District Assemblies may issue liquor licenses to premises that meet legal requirements.
plainExplanation: If your business meets liquor licensing standards, you must be issued a license. Refusal must be justified.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Community Center
legalText: Public community facilities shall be accessible to all residents without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use community centers. Refusal based on background or appearance is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register Funeral Home
legalText: Funeral homes shall be registered and comply with public health regulations.
plainExplanation: You can register a funeral home business. Refusal must be based on failure to meet health standards.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Playground
legalText: Every child has the right to recreation and play in safe environments.
plainExplanation: Children cannot be denied access to public playgrounds. Refusal violates children's rights.

title: Refusal to Issue Pharmacy License
legalText: A person may apply to operate a pharmacy upon meeting professional and facility standards.
plainExplanation: Qualified pharmacists can open pharmacies. Refusal must be based on failure to meet standards.

title: Refusal to Allow Student Participation in Sports
legalText: Schools shall provide opportunities for sports and physical education to all students.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot exclude students from sports without valid reason. Participation is part of education.

title: Refusal to Issue Cottage Industry Permit
legalText: District Assemblies shall regulate and permit small-scale industries operating from homes.
plainExplanation: You can operate a small home-based business with a permit. Refusal must be based on zoning or nuisance concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Art Gallery
legalText: Every person is entitled to enjoy, practice, profess, maintain and promote any culture, language, tradition or religion.
plainExplanation: You have the right to access cultural institutions like art galleries. Refusal based on background is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register Daycare Center
legalText: Daycare centers shall be registered and meet prescribed standards for child care.
plainExplanation: You can register a daycare if you meet safety and care standards. Refusal must be based on legitimate concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Museum
legalText: Every person is entitled to enjoy, practice, profess, maintain and promote any culture, language, tradition or religion.
plainExplanation: Public museums must be accessible to all. Refusal based on appearance or background is discrimination.

title: Refusal to Issue Hairdressing Salon Permit
legalText: Personal care businesses shall be licensed and comply with health and safety standards.
plainExplanation: You can open a hairdressing salon with proper permits. Refusal must be based on health or safety violations.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Join School Club
legalText: Schools shall encourage student participation in extracurricular activities and clubs.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot arbitrarily exclude students from clubs. Participation supports holistic education.

title: Refusal to Issue Tax Clearance Certificate
legalText: The Commissioner shall issue tax clearance certificates to compliant taxpayers.
plainExplanation: If your taxes are paid up, GRA must issue a clearance certificate. Refusal without cause is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Swimming Pool
legalText: Public recreational facilities shall be accessible to all residents without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use public swimming pools. Refusal based on background or appearance is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register Fishing Vessel
legalText: Fishing vessels shall be registered and comply with maritime safety and fishing regulations.
plainExplanation: You can register your fishing boat if it meets safety standards. Refusal must be based on legitimate concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Use School Library
legalText: Schools shall provide library facilities and ensure student access to educational materials.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot deny students access to the library. It's an essential educational resource.

title: Refusal to Issue Hotel Operating License
legalText: Hotels and hospitality businesses shall be licensed upon meeting prescribed standards.
plainExplanation: You can operate a hotel with proper licensing. Refusal must be based on failure to meet standards.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Botanical Garden
legalText: All public lands, waters, and resources shall be held in trust for the people of Ghana.
plainExplanation: Public botanical gardens belong to all citizens. You cannot be denied access without lawful reason.

title: Refusal to Register Taxi Service
legalText: Commercial transport services shall be registered and comply with safety regulations.
plainExplanation: You can register a taxi service if you meet safety standards. Refusal must be based on legitimate concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Attend School Trip
legalText: Schools shall organize educational trips and ensure equal participation opportunities.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot exclude students from educational trips without valid reason. It's part of learning.

title: Refusal to Issue Bakery Operating Permit
legalText: Food processing establishments shall be licensed and comply with health standards.
plainExplanation: You can operate a bakery with proper permits. Refusal must be based on health or safety violations.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Sports Stadium
legalText: Public sports facilities shall be accessible to all residents without discrimination.
plainExplanation: You have the right to use public sports facilities. Refusal based on background is unlawful.

title: Refusal to Register Cleaning Service Business
legalText: Service businesses shall be registered with the appropriate local authority.
plainExplanation: You can register a cleaning service business. Refusal must be based on legitimate regulatory concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Use Science Lab
legalText: Schools shall provide laboratory facilities and ensure student access for practical learning.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot deny students access to science labs. It's essential for science education.

title: Refusal to Issue Tailoring Shop Permit
legalText: Small businesses and trades shall be registered with the District Assembly.
plainExplanation: You can operate a tailoring shop with proper registration. Refusal must be based on zoning or other legitimate concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Access to Public Concert
legalText: All persons shall have the right to freedom of assembly including entertainment events.
plainExplanation: Public concerts must be accessible to all who purchase tickets. Refusal based on appearance is discrimination.

title: Refusal to Register Photography Business
legalText: Creative and professional services shall be registered with the appropriate authority.
plainExplanation: You can register a photography business. Refusal must be based on legitimate regulatory concerns.

title: Refusal to Allow Student to Participate in Cultural Events
legalText: Schools shall encourage student participation in cultural and artistic activities.
plainExplanation: Schools cannot exclude students from cultural events without valid reason. It's part of holistic education.
